WRITING.TEXT: I love my scars.

I relate to this so much. I could #8217;ve written it. I go back to work next week and work in social services so it #8217;s completely inappropriate to have fresh wounds showing. Wishing you the best!
#128514; I was clean for a year and now I #8217;ve been relapsing all week
CONGRATS!!! #128155;
I used to cut words I felt described me on my arms. No one would ask about it.
YES! Gotta always be comfy. And this photo is beautiful #128155;
Yep! I have a large tattoo on one arm and don #8217;t self harm on that arm because I don #8217;t want the scars to take away from the beautiful tattoo.
Yep! It #8217;s called I am Sober
I low key love when they turn purple
Wear your booty shorts proudly and comfortably #128155;
I also relapsed this week after 1 year clean. And it #8217;s been really hard to get back on track. We #8217;ve got this though
Depending on age You could just say they #8217;re old ouchies and if she asks from what, you don #8217;t remember #128155;

When I was younger I used to cut and now I #8217;m only burning since my last relapse. The scars from the burns are worse than any other scar I #8217;ve had and they take ages to heal. You are not weak for not being able to do it.
Tomorrow is a new day #128155;

WRITING.TITLE: TW: Suicidal when drunk
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m thinking about quitting drinking because I get incredibly suicidal when I #8217;m drunk. Does this happen to anyone else? Do you find that you need to stop drinking entirely?
Thanks for your response. I do get treatment for my mental health.
While I was in quarantine due to the pandemic my hours were traditionally in the daytime but that was pretty abnormal.
I think that #8217;s exactly what my thought process is. I #8217;ll have to look into those studies.

I think I know which TikTok you #8217;re talking about. It really rubbed me the wrong way. As someone with triggers, at least trigger warnings are so appreciated by me. I feel like it #8217;s just something respectful to do.
The risk of addiction that comes with it is not worth it. First started sh about 10 years ago and still struggling.

I hate the look of burn scars when they are random and blobby but I love burning so I #8217;ve been heating up the blunt edge of a knife and I guess branding myself and the scars look like cuts but a little thicker.
Scrolled past this with the lighter in my hand #128514;
It completely depends on the facility. I #8217;ve been to one place that I wish no one ever had to go to, and I #8217;ve been to another place that was genuinely helpful and kept me safe.
When I asked my artist she said they usually need to be 1-3 years old.

I accidentally hit styro with my pyro last night in the shittiest spot between some tattoos I have. And my fav part of heat yeets is to interfere with healing so I know it #8217;s going to be a bad scar.

Mine have never turned black, but I have one burn scar on my ankle that is pretty permanently purple. It seems like my other burn scars turn purple based on temperature? Mostly when it #8217;s cold out.

I used to cut, but I only brand and burn now. I have some pretty bad scars from doing it. But I love the process. In my experience I love the pain when doing it, but healing it much less painful/itchy than cuts.

WRITING.TITLE: Laid off again
WRITING.TEXT: I work in social services so have a pretty good motivator not to have any visible sh marks. However I just basically lost my job. I didn #8217;t love my job, but it still helped give me structure and a reason to stay safe. Just frustrated...feeling kind of hopeless.
Such a beautiful tattoo!

I #8217;m so sorry you don #8217;t have the support you deserve. As for being a PhD student, I totally relate to your concerns. I #8217;m starting my masters in social work with an emphasis in mental health (lol) in the fall and feel like such a fraud. Just know that even when it feels like you #8217;re alone in your struggles, people out there relate.

Just remember that a lot of people want other people to look at their social media and feel exactly how you do. They don #8217;t want people to know their failures and when they aren #8217;t doing great. I know you #8217;re struggling but no ones life is as perfect as they make it seem.
I love this so much
Start small! Wear shorts out to do a small errand or something like that. Don #8217;t set yourself up to be uncomfortable all day.
I have one on the back of my neck!

WRITING.TITLE: Sh evolving
WRITING.TEXT: Just something I noticed today and wanted to share. When I was not an adult and self harming, I definitely recognized that cutting did not benefit me in any way. But I continued to do it because of an addiction and routine. I recently relapsed the worst I have in years and have started burning. The issue is that I feel like it is helping. I crave the sensation when I burn myself, but also when I am burning I am able to just breathe in and out and relax. Like get actual air that isn #8217;t anxious or forced. Has anyone else experienced anything like this?

I cut because it was the coping skill that I knew and always had. I #8217;m not sure either but it #8217;s been a daily struggle for 10+ years. I guess I was just pointing out the differences in cutting and burning for me.
I #8217;m getting a sternum tattoo today and hoping for the same results! Whatever works right?

Thank you for sharing your story. I hardcore relate to the symptoms of depression you described. I just started drinking again to help me feel something different. I know it #8217;s not much, but I wish you the best.

That #8217;s my favorite place to sh because I can still wear short sleeves. I wouldn #8217;t be worried to much since it #8217;s a new place. If it continues or gets worse I #8217;d get it checked out though

I #8217;ve been going through the same thing. I #8217;ve been having the urge to burn my forehead near my hair line. Lately I #8217;ve been going seven days and then relapsing but I recently got a pretty painful tattoo so I was hoping that would hold me over. Along with picking scabs from last week.

I tried drinking to curb the urge to burn tonight but now I #8217;m just pretty buzzed and still want to burn. I have found that Weed does help though. Find of makes me want to try other drugs to help.

I know this post is old but I totally relate to the food thing. I never have the energy to cook so if I have to eat, I #8217;ll usually pick up fast food which has caused some weight gain. If I don #8217;t eat out (and even sometimes when I do), no food sounds good or like anything I want to eat. Now I have anxiety related to eating or even grocery shopping (not ED related) so I #8217;ve just associated it with the depression and anxiety.
Are there any CG approved curl creams that come in a pump? I #8217;m really only seeing ones that come in tubs or squeeze bottles.

Hi! I #8217;m queer and was raised Christian. I #8217;ve been struggling with religion since firmly and proudly accepting my sexuality. Just know that there are proud gay and queer Christians out there. And there are churches that will accept you for who you are. You will find people who want you to change, people who #8216;accept #8217; you but think you should remain celibate and not engage in same sex relationships, and then those who truly and wholly accept you and your sexuality. Do your research and know that there are places you and your sexuality and religion will be accepted.

When I was researching low waste beauty options, flaxseed gel came up a lot and I #8217;ve seen it in a few posts here. I think you can easily make your own and store it in a reusable jar. I think there are also bars on low-poo shampoos. I #8217;m sure there are also conditioners and other products that you might be able to find in glass jars.

WRITING.TITLE: Messy house, messy mind
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m moving into a new place after being at my last place for two years in a very small room. My depression made it hard to keep up with cleaning, taking care of my spaces, and just me in general. I #8217;m excited for my new place as it #8217;s bigger and nicer. But I find myself wanting to buy all these new things in hopes of living in a cleaner space. I think in my head my belongings are just associated with filth and mess and I want a fresh start. Has anyone else experienced this? Or am I just being materialistic?

WRITING.TITLE: My burn scars are turning purple/black.

WRITING.TEXT: I picked these scabs constantly so if you take care of them and don #8217;t interfere with the healing, they may look better.
Love your tattoo #128155;

I had one of the worst panic attacks ever when I moved into college. I know it #8217;s hard right now with Covid, but finding people really helped me. There #8217;s usually a lot of events during move in days so go to those and meet people! I know it might seem like everyone is already friends and in their groups, but they aren #8217;t and you aren #8217;t alone.

I know it #8217;s scary but it might be helpful to tell them how you are feeling. Whether it result in validation that they are not engaging in those behaviors, or maybe they do need a little check. You guys are sharing a space and everyone deserves to feel safe and comfortable in their own home. I really hope the situation improves soon
I just adopted my cat and I swear he is more excited for human food than his own.

Is it normal for hair to be flat/ not as curly as usual when first starting the curly girl method? I #8217;m about a week in and started with the clarifying wash. I #8217;ve tried Herbal Essences totally twisted mousse and Curls Creme br #251;l #233;e whipped cream. And my curls just aren #8217;t the same as with the previous products I was using.
Thank you. Previous products were not CG approved but I did not use any heat.
Scrunching. I was thinking about trying to rake them through?
My psychiatrist prefers to see people in person because it #8217;s more personable. Maybe they are rotating through patients to allow some in person visits.

This looks really great! I like that you can document urges and it shows your streaks on a calendar. Something else I like (that some people may disagree with),that sets it apart from other apps is that there is no #8216;community #8217; feature or public chat sections. I know these can be helpful for some people or a place to receive and offer encouragement, but I personally find these features triggering and they weigh me down. Considering there are other apps and communities (like this) that are there for people who want to use them, I like that it is lacking in your app. I would totally download and use this app!
I am in love with this
